def: Someone willing to take the risks involved in starting a new business
Raw materials that have not yet been used or products that have been made but not sold. There are also called stocks.
Money that is available from within the business. EG retained profits.
Money put into the business by its owners
A payment made in order to borrow money. It means a business pays back more than it borrows.
A person or organisation that owns part of a company.
Something that is owned by a business. EG Machinery or buildings
A period of time which suppliers allow customers before payment for supplies must be made.
Refers to money that comes from outside the business. EG A loan from a bank.
An asset that a bank holds as security for the repayment of a loan
Loads from banks and build societies that are used to buy land and buildings.
Organisations that offer a range of financial services. Mostly they provide savings accounts and mortgages.
A flexible loan which businesses can use up to a agreed limit
